html:
seed of Sihor/harvest of the river. Seed and harvest refer to the grain produced near Sihor (Josh. 13:3) and the Nile River and shipped by the Phoenicians over great waters to other nations, thereby providing Phoenicia with revenue.

market place of nations. During Isaiah's time, Tyre and Sidon were the Mediterranean's most powerful commercial cities; the Mediterranean nations all traded with Phoenicia.
